subject: Re: About the value of JUnit
msgSnippet: ... 1 week is no experience at all .  I have more than 2 years of experience with JUnit and I can tell you that there s a _huge_ difference between the tests
messageBody:
> I use JUnit since one week.
> I didn't use JTest but I will test it.

1 week is "no experience at all". I have more than 2 years of
experience with JUnit and I can tell you that there's a _huge_
difference between the tests I wrote when I began and the ones I write
now.

> I read a lot about the problems of JUnit/TDD.

links please. I'm interested to read more about those problems.

> Maybe I change my opinion. But I am not so blind to overlook all the
> problems concerning JUnit/TDD.

I don't say (and I think nobody says) that JUnit is perfect (why do
you think I'm managing JUnit-addons?) but it gives you enough freedom
to write and test pretty much whatever you want. But of course you
have to invest some time understanding the framework.

Since I haven't used JTest (well, $3500...) I can't really say if
JTest would be more useful *for me* than JUnit + my addons. But I
will first learn DbC before learning a new test runner (JTest).

-Vladimir
